course_main_structural_unit.address:
Raekoja plats 2
20307 Narva linn, 
Ida-Virumaa 
EST

description.en: The course provides a deeper understanding of the components of speech: their classification, grammatical forms and roles in a sentence. The course teaches students the grammar rules that are used to form sentences. Different sentence types and sentence structure are considered.
description.et: Kursus annab sügavamad teadmised kõne koostisosadest: nende klassifikatsioon, grammatilised vormid ning rollid lauses. Kursus õpetab üliõpilastele grammatikareegleid, mille alusel moodustatakse sõnadest lauseid. Vaadeldakse erinevaid lausetüüpe ja lause struktuuri.

objectives.en: 1) introduce students to the morphology and syntax of the English language;
objectives.et: 1) tutvustada üliõpilastele inglise keele morfoloogiat ja süntaksi;

objectives.en: 2) to give an overview of the paradigm and convergence of word types;
objectives.et: 2) anda ülevaade sõnaliikide paradigmast ja ühildumisest.

objectives.en: 3) to teach students to correctly form words and sentences in English and to analyze words and sentences.
objectives.et: 3) õpetada üliõpilasi õigesti moodustama sõnu ja lauseid inglise keeles ja tegema sõnade ja lausete analüüsi.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) has theoretical knowledge of morphology structures and their peculiarities;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) omab teoreetilist teadmist morfoloogia struktuuridest ja nende omapärasustest;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) is able to classify and characterize speech components, grammatical forms and their role in sentences;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) oskab klassifitseerida ja iseloomustada kõne koostisosasid, grammatilisi vorme ning nende rolli lausetes;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) is able to form words based on the given strain;
learning_outcomes.et: 3) oskab vormistada sõnu antud tüve alusel;

learning_outcomes.en: 4) is able to perform morphological analysis of word types and distinguish between different types of words in a sentence;
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab teha sõnaliikide morfoloogilist analüüsi ja eristada sõnaliike lauses;

learning_outcomes.en: 5) has theoretical knowledge of the individual parts of a sentence and their peculiarities;
learning_outcomes.et: 5) omab teoreetilist teadmist lause üksikutest osadest ja nende omapärasustest;

learning_outcomes.en: 6) is able to construct grammatically correct sentences in English;
learning_outcomes.et: 6) oskab üles ehitada grammatiliselt õige lause inglise keeles;

learning_outcomes.en: 7) can perform syntactic analysis of sentences in English.
learning_outcomes.et: 7) oskab teha lause süntaktilist analüüsi inglise keeles

independent_work.et: Independent reading of coursebook materials, grammar exercises form support grammar books (e.g., by Vince M. 1994.Advanced Language Practice), morphological/syntactic sample analysis of newspaper texts (contract work)

description.et:
Tests on theory and practice
A- test questions are answered with maximum precision and reference to corresponding theoretical sources and are supported by references to the sample text
B- test questions are answered correctly and demonstrate very good knowledge of theoretical aspects and reference to the sample text.
C- test questions are answered with various degrees of precision and demonstrate good knowledge of theoretical aspects and are supported by references to the sample text
D- answers to test questions show the student's satisfactory knowledge of some theoretical aspects and do not have any support by example from the sample text
E- test answers demonstrate student's knowledge of some basic principles of morphological/syntactic text analysis.

grade_preconditions.et: Participation in study sessions and completion of all assignments in full volume.

grade_evaluation.et: The course is completed with a written examination which consists of theory questions and practical assignments in the morphology/syntax area.

debt_elimination.et: Two weeks to account for each missed test paper. Late submissions (after cut-off dates) shall not be accepted for grading and feedback.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
Anderson, C. (2020). Essentials of Linguistics. McMaster University Hamilton, Ontario.
Van Gelderen, E. (2010). An introduction to the grammar of English: Revised edition. Amsterdam: John Benjamins Publishing Company.
Vince, M. (1994). Advanced Language Practice. Heinemann.
resources.recommended_materials:
Greenbaum, S., Quirk, R. (2004) A Student's Grammar of the English Language, Longman.
Carter, R., McCarthy, M.(2006) Cambridge Grammar of English, CUP.

description.et:
The Subject of Morphology.
Word Classes; The Verb

The Verb : Tenses 		
Present /Past Tenses/Future Tenses, Sequence of Tenses

The subject of Syntax. 
The sentence. The types of sentence.

The simple sentence. The subject. The predicate. Agreement between subject and predicate
Mid-term morphology test

The object. The predicative
The adverbial modifier. The attribute
The compound sentence. The complex sentence. Predicative, subject, object and attributive complexes
Types of subordinate clauses. The complex-compound sentence

Consolidation; exam consultation 
End of term syntax test
